intro: Pteromonnina stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pteromonnina, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, this plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in shrubland or grassland habitats. The plant plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features.
